quest.name: A Hunter's True Nature
journal: Hervoix has a bone to pick with O'bhen Tia.

With his tasks finally complete, Hervoix decides he will no longer tolerate this treatment from O'bhen Tia, and rushes off to finally say his piece. Follow him and speak with O'bhen Tia to hear what is sure to be a profanity-laced tirade.

Hervoix finally builds up the courage to vent his frustrations to O'bhen Tia, but the chief interrupts the poor hunter and runs off in pursuit of reported outlaws. Nonetheless, Hervoix is determined to get his word in and follows after O'bhen Tia, throwing caution to the wind. Go after Hervoix and make sure he does not fall prey to the cunning outlaws.

You come upon Hervoix as he is being beset on by a renegade hunter. You fell your adversary after a brief skirmish, and Hervoix thanks you for your rescue. Unsurprisingly, you find out this incident was the first time Hervoix had ever been in a fight. Hervoix proceeds deeper into the forest in pursuit of O'bhen Tia─follow him and make sure he is not attacked again.

After following Hervoix's trail, you come upon O'bhen Tia and several other hunters among the remnants of a recently abandoned outlaw camp. Hervoix expresses confusion as to why these hunters have earned the ire of Tailfeather, and in response O'bhen Tia finally elucidates the purpose of the tasks he sent Hervoix out to do. The chocobo hunters of Tailfeather respect the natural balance of the Chocobo Forest, while acknowledging the fact that without the birds, their livelihoods would disappear. As such, they are loath to tolerate hunters that disrupt the delicate order to make easy coin. The tasks assigned by O'bhen Tia were meant to give Hervoix a deeper understanding of the Tailfeather philosophy. Hervoix, surprised at the deep consideration displayed by his chief, accidentally lets slip that it was actually you who performed the tasks O'bhen Tia had requested. However, with any luck, and a large heaping of punishment, Hervoix will be able to use this newfound knowledge to further his growth as a hunter, and possibly find the motivation to complete even the most menial of tasks with his own two hands.
objectives: Search for Hervoix and rescue him if he is in danger.

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: Well, looks like I've finally completed the tasks on this list. What in the seven hells was the point of it all...

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: To think I ever respected O'bhen Tia. His mind is on the menial and routine, not hunting.

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: I'll no longer be his bloody lackey. He's about to get a piece of my mind!

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: I ain't doing his dirty work any longer. If he wants to keep me on, he's gotta treat me like a hunter!

dialogue.name: OBHENTIA
dialogue.text: Those...godsdamned...

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: Chief! I finished your bloody errands, and I've got something to say! I─

dialogue.name: OBHENTIA
dialogue.text: I ain't got time to listen to yer prattlin'. A band o' outlaws have been sighted just northwest o' here. Now's our chance to be rid o' them afore they vanish into the woods!

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: Outlaws!? And you mean to go after them? But... I've not spoken─

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: Godsdammit, there he goes, storming off without listening to a word I have to say. Well, I'll not be ignored so easily. Come on, adventurer, and be on your guard─there's outlaws about!

dialogue.name: BALOON
dialogue.text: Die, Tailfeather scum!

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> Adventurer, you have my thanks. I saw the bandit steal upon me, but I've─<pant>─never been in a fight before. You see, I'm a hunter...

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: Well, we shouldn't have far to go from here. Follow me, and keep your weapon at the ready!

dialogue.name: OBHENTIA
dialogue.text: Bloody bastards! Where'd they make off to!?

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: Ah, you're here!

dialogue.name: OBHENTIA
dialogue.text: The godsdamned cowards ran off afore we could give 'em a proper punishment!

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: Chief, I've never seen you so livid. What makes these hunters different from us, for you to despise them so? It seems they've been doing more hunting than we have lately...

dialogue.name: OBHENTIA
dialogue.text: Are ye daft, boy!? These outlaws hunt how they like, and spit on our rules. Rules that're there for a reason. What do you reckon'll happen if we let 'em keep huntin' without consequence? Do ye think chocobos just appear outta thin air?

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: The chocobos will... They'll go extinct! By the Twelve! Then what'll we hunt!?

dialogue.name: OBHENTIA
dialogue.text: What a surprise─ye figured it out all on yer own! We lot are chocobo hunters, and we can't very well hunt somethin' that's not there, can we?

dialogue.name: OBHENTIA
dialogue.text: Now, huntin's not just about takin' what ye want an' sellin' it for gil. The forest's got a natural balance, one that us hunters've gotta maintain, even if it means doin' the jobs that'll get that pretty coat dirty. If ye can't get that through yer head then yer no better than the outlaws!

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: So that's why... Chief, I had no idea!

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: It all makes sense now... So all those errands were meant to make me understand...

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: I... If I had but known, I wouldn't have asked this adventurer to help me with...everything...

dialogue.name: OBHENTIA
dialogue.text: What? Ye mean to say ye didn't actually do any of yer work?

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: I-I mean...shehe did─ I mean I did...

dialogue.name: HERVOIX
dialogue.text: Not in the faaace!

obj.n: A Step in the Right Direction
